com.thomsonreuters.upa.examples.common

Class ChannelSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thomsonreuters.upa.examples.common.ChannelSession
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EDFChannelSession

    public class ChannelSession
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages UPA channel and provides methods for connection establishment, channel initialization, read, and write methods for Consumer and NIProvider example applications.

    Usage of this class within the Consumer and NIProvider applications:
    1. Call initTransport(boolean, Error) to initialize UPA
    2. Call connect(InProgInfo, Error).
    3. Call initChannel(InProgInfo, Error) in loop until channel becomes active that is channel state is ChannelState.ACTIVE.
    4. When channel state is ChannelState.ACTIVE, send Login Request.
    5. Read and process responses.

    This class also detects connection failures and provides a query method for the application to retry connection establishment.

    This class is a wrapper utility class for UPA's Channel and Transport classes and handles typical return codes from UPA, for example, file descriptor changes during read, connection failures, registering for write when there is more data in the queue, flushing of data after write, flush failures.

    See Also:
    Transport.initialize(InitArgs, Error), Transport.connect(ConnectOptions, Error), Channel.init(InProgInfo, Error), Channel.read(ReadArgs, Error), Channel.write(TransportBuffer, WriteArgs, Error)

    • Method Detail

      • selectTime

        public boolean selectTime(long selectTime)
        Allows the user to specify a select timeout. The default select timeout will be one third of the channel's negotiated ping time out. Providers will use this method to control their content update time.
        Parameters:
        selectTime - a value greater than zero.
        Returns:
        true if the selectTime was greater than zero.

        public int initTransport(boolean globalLock,
                         com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport.Error error)
        Initializes the UPA transport API and all internal members.
        This is the first method called when using the UPA. It initializes internal data structures.
        Parameters:
        globalLock - flag to enable global locking on UPA Transport
        error - UPA Error, to be populated in event of an error
        Returns:
        TransportReturnCodes

      • connect

        public int connect(com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport.InProgInfo inProg,
                   com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport.Error error)
        Establishes the outbound connection to the UPA server. If connection is established, registers the channel for read and write select operation. It recovers connection in case of connection failure. It assumes application has called initTransport(boolean, Error) before calling this method.

        Typical usage is for establishing connection is:
        1. Call connect(InProgInfo, Error).
        2. Call initChannel(InProgInfo, Error) in loop until channel becomes active, ChannelState.ACTIVE

        Parameters:
        inProg - - InProgInfo
        error - - UPA error information in case of connection failure.
        Returns:
        TransportReturnCodes
        See Also:
        Transport.connect(ConnectOptions, Error)
